alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 16 at 9:25PM EDT until September 16 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of DownEast Maine, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Machias, Lubec, Eastport, Perry, Pembroke, Cutler, East Machias, Machiasport, Marshfield, Whiting, Dennysville, Roque Bluffs, Whitneyville, Northfield, Edmunds, Marion and Trescott. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
